To whom it may concern, 

I am one of the graduates of Class of 2019 and I am writing to express my disappointment and anger on the change of venue and schedule of the Congregation Ceremony.  

The Atrium has long been the venue of the Congregation Ceremony and it has gradually become one of the traditions in HKUST. Yet, two weeks before the Ceremony, Organizing Committee of the 27th Congregation announced the adjustments to the format of the 2019 Congregation through email, including the change of venue from the Atrium to Sports Hall and LT-L. USTers, especially the Class of 2019, were shocked and swollen with anger by the news.

The email stated that the updated arrangement is to mitigate the potential safety risks in the large-scaled event. However, the University did not explain what the risks are. From the reply of the Committee, it was mentioned that they have gone through certain risk assessments before making the decision, but none of the details of the risk assessments was listed. In short, the statement of changing the venue is ambiguous and inconvincible. 

The Organizing Committee has been widely reviled because of the choice of venue. Neither Sports Hall nor LT-L is considered as a solemn venue for the congregation ceremony. Apparently, the Committee did not put themselves into the shoes of the graduates or cater for our needs. It is disrespectful when the Organizing Committee rode roughshod over our opinions. 

In the meantime, the responses of the University after Council Election for Student member were unacceptable. The University claimed that the investigation on malicious complaints of the elected councilor for student member, Miss Fu will last for a month, right after the Congregation Ceremony. The investigation process is unreasonably lengthy, and it is doubted that the procrastination of the case is a political measure to suppress the voice of the students. 

And now, I will list out the demands and expect the University will take them into considerations: 

1. Resume the construction of stage for Congregation Ceremony in Atrium now
2. Contact the Student Union and collect student’s views as soon as possible
3. Withdraw the decision of change of venue of the Congregation Ceremony
4. Invite Miss Fu to attend Congregation Ceremony as a university councilor officially

The Congregation Ceremony is one of the important moments in our lifetime. For the graduates' sake, it is strongly advised that the University should withdraw the decision of change of venue of the upcoming Congregation Ceremony as well as give us a solid response on the Council Election’s affairs.

The HKUST students and I are looking forward to your genuine reply.

Yours Faithfully,
(student name)
(student number)
